front.title: The TLD Subdomain Structure Protocol and its use for Cookie domain validation

abstract.t: This document defines a protocol and specification format that can be used by a client to discover how a Top Level Domain (TLD) is organized in terms of what subdomains are used to place closely related but independent domains, e.g. commercial domains in country code TLDs (ccTLD) like .uk are placed in the .co.uk subTLD domain. This information is then used to limit which domains an Internet service can set cookies for, strengthening the rules already defined by the cookie specifications.
